name: The Yucatan Peninsula Quiz | Environment | 15 Questions

questions.text: What Mexican states comprise the majority of the Yucatan peninsula?
questions.explanation:
Yucatan, Quintana Roo, Campeche.

	Most of the familiar vacation spots, like Cancun and Cozumel, are in Quintana Roo.

questions.text: What is the topography of the Yucatan Peninsula?
questions.correct: Mostly flat, with some hills in the south.
questions.explanation:
Mostly flat, with some hills in the south.

	The further south you go, the more mountainous it gets.

questions.text: What is geographically unusual about the Yucatan Peninsula?
questions.correct: It is primarily composed of limestone
options: It contains many deposits of fine gemstones
It is famous for fossils of herbivorous dinosaurs
questions.explanation:
It is primarily composed of limestone.

	The peninsula is basically a limestone rock covered wth plantlife! This leads to little water aboveground, despite the lush plant growth.

questions.text: Fresh water in the Yucatan is often found in large sinkholes where the substrate has collapsed over an underground river. What are these sinkholes called?
questions.explanation:
Cenotes.

	The cenotes were often a part of Mayan rituals. Sacrificial objects (and people!) were tossed into them.

questions.text: Who were the primary native people of the region?
questions.explanation:
Maya.

	The Mayans built magnificent cities and temples. Most of the people in the area are still Mayan.

questions.text: What is the name of the most famous ruin in the region?
questions.explanation:
Chichen Itza.

	There are many other Mayan ruins in the area, such as Tulum, Coba and Uxmal. Palenque is in the state of Chiapas.

questions.text: The Yucatan has several Biosphere Reserves, areas designated by the United Nations as places of special ecological significance. For what is the Rio Celestun Biosphere Reserve most famous?
questions.explanation:
Flamingos.

	Huge flocks of flamingos nest and winter there.

questions.text: What is the primary vegetation community of the Yucatan?
questions.explanation:
Tropical dry forest.

	The Yucatan has a dry season from about December-May.

questions.text: The Yucatan is home to many spectacular birds. Which one would not be found there?
questions.explanation:
Scarlet macaw.

	The scarlet macaw has been nearly exterminated in Mexico due to the pet trade.

questions.text: For what habitat is Cozumel Island most known?
questions.explanation:
Coral reefs.

	The reefs at Cozumel are among the most spectacular in the world and were made famous by Jacques Cousteau. Diving is one of the primary tourist attractions.

questions.text: Which monkey would be found in the Yucatan?
questions.explanation:
Black howler monkey.

	These monkeys are named for their very loud calls.

questions.text: A common poisonous snake of the area is also known as the 'terciopelo'- literally the 'three-step snake' due to the strength of its venom. By what name is this snake more commonly known?
questions.explanation:
Fer-de-lance.

	It is related to the rattlesnake.

questions.text: This large, herbivorous sea mammal is found in sheltered bays on the Yucatan coastline.
questions.explanation:
Manatee.

	The huge manatee eats only plants.

questions.text: Several hatcheries in the Yucatan are devoted to raising and releasing these animals.
questions.explanation:
Sea turtles.

	The eggs of the turtles are collected from the beach before predators can eat them, and the young are raised to a size where they are likely to survive before being released.
